name: Villa Seminyak Estate & Spa

reviews.text: We stayed at the Villa Seminyak Estate for 5 days in June - this is just before the high season starts which might be why we were upgraded from a Deluxe villa to a Royal Villa - OMG - total luxury - huge garden, great pool. All the facilities are very clean and well kept - you can see its an older venue though - not as flashy as some of the newer 5 star hotels - but it depends what you want - yep, the kitchen is a bit tatty - but are you really going to be cooking?
reviews.title: Ignore those bad reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms were huge, beds comfy (firm) - and beautiful outlook onto the gardens. yes, there are mosquitos - it is bali after all - but not as many as another more flashy place i visited. Like all hotels they come in each night and spray and set up the rooms but I'd still take the aerogard - also - go in the dry season like we did and you are better off.
reviews.title: Paradise in Paradise

reviews.text: We were upgraded from a deluxe pool villa to a Royal Villa, which has a big garden and pool. Only issue was that it was a bit old (10+ years), whereas the deluxe pool villas seem to be newer. The Lagoon villas are not so nice, but the rest of the resort is good value for money only 5 minutes walk from the main street in Seminyak (Bintang Supermarket).
reviews.title: Very hospitable and nice
Ignore the negative reviews, this place is amazing!

reviews.text: Firstly, the staff are brilliant. I can't say enough good things about the staff.
reviews.title: So so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, that doesn't make up for the fact that the villas are quite rundown. Very average. Paint peeling off walls, gardens in the villas are tiny and half-dead. Stains around the toilet which isn't very nice at all.
reviews.title: Beautiful! But make sure you book a Private Villa, not the Lagoon!!

reviews.text: The beds are very comfy by hotel standards.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the pretty pictures!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the only review I have ever written but felt so strongly about the Villa Seminyak Estate & Spa, I don't want any one caught like we were. We stayed one night, that was enough. I can't speak about the private Villas we booked a Lagoon villa, They looked great on the brochure from our travel agent in Australia and the website looked fantastic. What a disappointment.. Our lagoon villa was old and dirty. we were told there is a small kitchenette, Hell if you call a sink and 3 cups a kitchen ! We had booked for 2 weeks, it would have been a long 2 weeks. the only furniture in the villa, 2 cane chairs, and a coffee table. there is no lounge or any thing else to sit on just 2 cane chairs. The bath was a concrete trough rendered in some pretend finish, the taps and shower head had spots of rust on them. The toilet was stained with urine on the floor, and the curtains had water stains all over them. We complained to our travel agent but guess what ? This hotel will not allow refunds. I wonder why ? during the short time before we checked out there were Three more couples I know of ,trying to get a refund and check out. There is no glass in the windows in the Bathroom or the so called Kitchenette and we were woken in the morning by a stream of sunlight comming through the hole in our thatched roof, and i do mean a Hole. the skirting boards were covered in dirt and grime and there were water streakes running down the wall from the airconditioner.
reviews.title: Warning ! Warning ! Warning !

description: Villas Bali: Villa Seminyak Estate & Spa awaits you with a combination of traditional and Luxury private pool villas with private swimming pools, is the perfect group or family villa, Honeymoon, Holidays, and vacation choice for a memorable get together with friends or for your family holiday.
